rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.

'''Ahmad Shah Massoud''' (Ø§Ø­ÙØ¯ Ø´Ø§Ù ÙØ³Ø¹ÙØ¯- ''Aá¸¥mad Å Äh Mas'Å«d''; September 1953 – September 9, 2001) was a [[Kabul University]] engineering student turned military leader who played a leading role in driving the [[Red Army|Soviet army]] out of [[Afghanistan]], earning him the nickname '''Lion of [[Panjshir Province|Panjshir]]'''. His followers also call him '''Ämer SÄheb-e ShahÄ«d''' (''Our Beloved Martyred Commander'').<ref name="Webster University Press Book"/> The Wall Street Journal at that time dedicated one of its covers to Massoud calling him "the Afghan who won the Cold War". Following the withdrawal of [[Soviet war in Afghanistan|Soviet troops from Afghanistan]] and the subsequent collapse of the [[Democratic Republic of Afghanistan|Soviet-backed government]] of [[Mohammad Najibullah]], Massoud became the [[Afghan Ministry of Defense|Defense Minister]] in 1992 under the government of [[Burhanuddin Rabbani]]. Following the rise of the [[Taliban]] in 1996, Massoud returned to the role of an armed opposition leader, serving as the military commander of the [[United Islamic Front for the Salvation of Afghanistan|United Islamic Front]] (Northern Alliance).

His followers also call him '''Ämer SÄheb-e ShahÄ«d''' (''Our Beloved Martyred Commander'').<ref name="Webster University Press Book"/> The Wall Street Journal at that time dedicated one of its covers to Massoud calling him "the Afghan who won the Cold War". Following the withdrawal of [[Soviet war in Afghanistan|Soviet troops from Afghanistan]] and the subsequent collapse of the [[Democratic Republic of Afghanistan|Soviet-backed government]] of [[Mohammad Najibullah]], Massoud became the [[Afghan Ministry of Defense|Defense Minister]] in 1992 under the government of [[Burhanuddin Rabbani]].
